job_description:
Sr. DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes, enforcing security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation for secure, scalable cloud environments. Requires 4–8 years of DevSecOps experience with expertise in Terraform, Ansible, and AWS.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role, not a screen updater role, and not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analyzed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities - Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly. - Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement. - Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding. - Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies. - Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations. - Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute. - Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies. - Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria. - Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use. - Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding. - Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria. - Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately. - Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly. - Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development. - Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability. - Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience - Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking. - Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic. - Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications. - Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity. - Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity. - Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams. - Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions. - Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions. - Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage. - Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs. - Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers. - Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field - 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst - Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments - Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems - Ability to run independent client workshops - Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst at 2Base drives requirement precision and cross-team alignment through functional modeling, system reasoning, and clear documentation.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across requirements and stakeholder deliverables.

job_description:
Sr SEO Analyst

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Sr SEO Analyst to own and drive overall SEO performance across all clients. This role involves leading the SEO team, managing client relationships, defining SEO strategies, ensuring execution excellence, and delivering measurable business results. You will act as the primary decision-maker and escalation point for all SEO-related matters while maintaining high standards of quality, governance, and client satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities

  • Core Role: Own overall SEO strategy, quality, delivery, and outcomes across all SEO clients. Act as the strategic owner and escalation point for SEO performance. Ensure consistent growth and ROI through effective SEO initiatives.
  • Leadership & Team Management: Oversee day-to-day operations of the SEO team. Ensure optimal workload distribution, productivity, and quality output. Represent the SEO team in internal and client meetings. Act as the final escalation authority for SEO-related issues.
  • Client SEO Ownership: Own end-to-end SEO performance for assigned and key clients. Drive growth through strategy development, approval, and execution oversight. Ensure SEO activities align with client goals, industry standards, and local markets. Take full accountability for performance outcomes and challenges.
  • Strategy & Planning: Develop and manage SEO roadmaps for key and high-value clients. Define priorities across: Technical SEO, On-page SEO, Off-page SEO, Local SEO, Content SEO. Review performance regularly and optimize strategies using data insights.
  • Quality Control & Governance: Review SEO audits, technical implementations, on-page work, and link-building activities. Ensure compliance with internal SOPs and best practices. Conduct final quality checks before client reporting. Minimize execution, reporting, and process errors.
  • Mentorship & Process Management: Provide continuous feedback and performance reviews. Upskill team members through training and SOP improvements. Maintain standardized documentation and workflows.
  • Client Communication & Management: Manage all SEO-related client communication. Handle coordination, clarifications, and approvals. Gather feedback and translate requirements into actionable tasks. Build long-term client relationships and ensure high satisfaction levels.
  • Reporting & Performance Tracking: Oversee preparation and validation of SEO performance reports. Maintain client trackers and performance dashboards. Ensure data accuracy and consistency. Create, update, and monitor monthly SEO team KPI sheets.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, IT, Business, or related field (preferred).
  • 5+ years of experience in SEO, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.
  • Strong expertise in technical, on-page, off-page, and local SEO.
  • Proficiency in tools such as Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, etc.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent client communication and presentation skills.
  • Proven experience managing and mentoring teams.
  • Strong documentation and process management abilities.

Contact: For inquiries, email your resume to hr@planetmedia.in.
summary: Lead SEO strategy and team for multiple clients, ensuring high-quality execution and client satisfaction. Manage SEO initiatives, mentor teams, and deliver measurable business results through data-driven strategies.

job_description:
The Company

CTeBS, a subsidiary of Classic Fashion, is a leading software solution provider to the apparel manufacturing industry globally. Our suite of enterprise-level products, including our flagship Trendz CMP, leverages cutting-edge technology to enhance productivity, quality, and efficiency, ensuring our clients achieve unparalleled growth and success. Our journey with Classic Fashion has uniquely positioned us to design technology-enabled products and solutions for the ever-evolving needs of the apparel manufacturing sector, and we are poised for an exciting phase of growth.

Job Summary

We are looking for a hands-on Software Architect who is passionate about building scalable, high-performance software. In this role, you will serve as the bridge between high-level architectural vision and low-level code implementation. Unlike a pure manager, you will remain deeply involved in the code. You will own the technical design for major features, enforce coding standards, and solve the complex problems that stall development teams. You will work closely with the Associate Technical Manager (who handles delivery/metrics) while you ensure the technical integrity of the solution.

Responsibilities

  • Take full architectural responsibility for specific products or core modules (e.g., the Production Planning Engine or Payroll Calculation System).
  • Translate business requirements into technical design documents (TDDs), defining data models, API contracts, and class structures before coding begins.
  • Proactively identify "spaghetti code" or technical debt in our legacy Java/MSSQL systems and design safe refactoring plans to modernize them.
  • Be the final approver for critical code merges. You do not just check for bugs; you check for maintainability, security, and scalability.
  • Deep dive into database execution plans (Oracle/MSSQL) and application logic to optimize slow queries and reduce latency.
  • Enforce consistent design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Observer, etc.) across the development team to ensure the codebase remains uniform.
  • Act as the "Problem Solver in Chief" for the development team. When a developer is stuck on a complex logic issue, you provide the solution.
  • Mentor Senior Developers on how to write clean, efficient, and testable code. Conduct technical workshops on new frameworks or best practices.

Qualifications

  • 8 to 12 years of software development experience, with at least 2+ years in a Software Architect Role.
  • Expert in Java/J2EE (Spring, Hibernate, Multithreading).
  • Strong proficiency in MSSQL or Oracle (Stored Procedures, Indexing, Partitioning).
  • Solid understanding of Angular component architecture (even if you don't write CSS daily, you understand the data flow).
  • Strong grasp of Object-Oriented Design (OOD), Microservices patterns, and RESTful API design.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitLab), Docker, and code quality tools (SonarQube).
  • Proven ability to debug complex production issues (memory leaks, thread deadlocks) under pressure.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@ctebs.com.
summary: Seeking a hands-on Software Architect with 8-12 years of experience in Java, MSSQL/Oracle, and Angular to lead technical design and mentor teams.

Senior Cloud Engineer

Closing Date: 28, Feb 2026 Job Published: 17, Feb 2026 Contact Email: jobs@techvantagesystems.com

Brief Description

We are building a dedicated Cloud Operations (CloudOps) function to establish strong operational ownership, governance discipline, and financial accountability across a complex Azure environment. The Senior Cloud Engineer will be part of the founding CloudOps team and will serve as an operational authority responsible for platform reliability, governance enforcement, cost control, and risk management. This role is focused on protecting the Azure estate, enforcing guardrails, and translating business risk into technical controls.

This is not a DevOps enablement or application delivery role. The mandate is to ensure structured, auditable, and cost-governed cloud operations by clearly defining boundaries between CloudOps, Platform Engineering, and Application Development teams.

Roles & Responsibilities

  1. Azure Operational Ownership
  2. Own Azure operational reliability, uptime, and overall platform readiness across production and non-production environments
  3. Ensure structured environment management across subscriptions and management groups

  4. Maintain formal operational discipline including runbooks, SOPs, and change control processes

  5. Incident & Risk Management

  6. Lead incident response and coordinate major incident handling
  7. Perform root cause analysis (RCA) and drive permanent remediation

  8. Establish preventive controls to reduce recurring incidents

  9. Governance & Guardrails Enforcement

  10. Design and enforce Azure governance guardrails including:
    • Azure Policy
    • RBAC
    • Privileged Identity Management (PIM)
    • Naming conventions
    • Tagging standards
  11. Identify and remediate governance drift
  12. Correct over-permissioned access models and unsafe deployment pipelines

  13. Ensure strict separation of operational responsibilities between CloudOps, Platform Engineering, and Application teams

  14. FinOps & Cost Accountability

  15. Own FinOps execution across the Azure estate
  16. Drive rightsizing initiatives and cost optimization programs
  17. Manage reservations and savings plans
  18. Implement cost allocation and spend accountability models

  19. Enforce cost guardrails aligned to business risk tolerance

  20. AKS Platform Operations

  21. Operate Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) with strong platform ownership
  22. Implement scaling discipline and node-level cost optimization

  23. Define and enforce workload responsibility boundaries

  24. Infrastructure as Code Governance

  25. Oversee operational integrity of IaC deployments (ARM, Bicep, Terraform)
  26. Ensure IaC aligns with governance, compliance, and security controls
  27. Prevent bypass of guardrails through automation pipelines

Preferred Skills

Mandatory Skill Set - 6+ years of hands-on Azure experience with direct production accountability - Strong ownership of: - Azure Subscriptions - Management Groups - Networking Architecture - Identity & Access Management (IAM) - Deep understanding of Azure governance frameworks - Hands-on experience with: - Azure Policy - RBAC - PIM - Azure Landing Zones - Strong FinOps knowledge including rightsizing, reservations, savings plans, and cost optimization strategies - Operational experience with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) - Strong knowledge of Infrastructure as Code: - ARM - Bicep - Terraform - Experience identifying and correcting governance drift - Experience handling over-permissioned environments and risky access models - Strong incident management and root cause analysis capability - Clear understanding that Operations, DevOps, and Development are separate disciplines

Good to Have Skill Set - Experience building Azure governance operating models from scratch - Exposure to multi-subscription enterprise Azure estates - Experience implementing Azure cost allocation models - Automation scripting (PowerShell / Azure CLI) - Exposure to audit and compliance frameworks - Experience in regulated environments

Mandatory Certifications

  • AZ-305 – Azure Solutions Architect Expert
  • AZ-104 – Azure Administrator
  • AZ-140 – Azure Virtual Desktop
  • AZ-900 – Azure Fundamentals
  • ITIL 4 Foundation (Strongly Preferred)
summary: Senior Cloud Engineer role focused on Azure governance, FinOps, and platform reliability. Requires 6+ years of Azure experience with mandatory certifications and governance expertise.

About Cocopalms Tech

Cocopalms Tech is a software product company building next-generation AI-enabled business solutions under the BizoSuite ecosystem, including ERP, accounting, meal prep management, CRM, and property management systems. We are transforming traditional business operations using intelligent automation and data-driven insights.

Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced AI Solutions Architect / AI Engineer to lead the design and implementation of AI capabilities across all our applications. This role is responsible for defining AI architecture, integrating AI services (LLMs, ML models, predictive analytics), and building scalable AI solutions that enhance business intelligence, automation, and customer experience across the BizoSuite ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities

AI Architecture & Strategy

  • Design company-wide AI architecture for all products.
  • Define reusable AI services and APIs across applications.
  • Establish AI integration standards and best practices.
  • Align AI strategy with business objectives and product vision.

AI Integration & Development

  • Integrate AI services such as OpenAI, Gemini, or local LLMs.
  • Design AI-driven dashboards for predictions, insights, and anomaly detection.
  • Develop AI modules for customer retention, sales forecasting, sales/promotion analytics, and meal recommendation intelligence.
  • Implement AI-powered insights and automation.

Machine Learning & Data Intelligence

  • Design ML pipelines using structured business data.
  • Develop predictive models for retention/churn analysis, demand forecasting, customer segmentation, and pricing/promotion analysis.
  • Work with analytics and reporting systems.

AI Platform Engineering

  • Build centralized AI services usable by multiple apps.
  • Design secure APIs between AI services and backend systems.
  • Ensure scalability for multi-tenant SaaS environments.
  • Optimize AI performance and cost.

Security & Governance

  • Ensure data privacy and secure AI usage.
  • Design AI workflows for on-prem enterprise deployments.
  • Implement responsible AI practices and auditability.

Cross-Team Collaboration

  • Work with product managers, developers, and leadership.
  • Mentor development teams on AI integration.
  • Translate business problems into AI solutions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, AI, ML, Data Science, or related field.
  • Master’s degree in AI/ML or Computer Science preferred.
  • Equivalent industry experience in large-scale AI solutions may substitute advanced education.
  • Relevant AI cloud certifications (Azure AI Engineer, AWS AI/ML, Google Vertex AI) are highly desirable.

What Makes This Role Unique

You will architect AI for an entire product ecosystem impacting: - Finance & ERP - Meal Prep Automation - Customer Management - Real Estate & Operations

This is a company-wide AI leadership position, not a single-project role.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong understanding of AI/ML architecture.
  • Experience with LLM integration (OpenAI, Gemini, etc.).
  • Knowledge of Python (ML pipelines), Node.js backend integration, REST APIs/microservices.
  • Experience with vector databases (pgvector, Qdrant, Pinecone), RDBMS (PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB), embeddings/RAG architecture.
  • Strong data modeling and analytics experience.

Machine Learning

  • Experience with XGBoost/LightGBM, forecasting models (Prophet, ARIMA), recommendation systems.
  • Understanding of model evaluation and deployment.

Architecture & Systems

  • Cloud/on-prem deployment experience.
  • Distributed systems and scalable architecture design.
  • API-first design approach.

Soft Skills

  • Product-oriented thinking.
  • Strong problem-solving ability.
  • Ability to communicate with technical and business teams.
  • Leadership and mentorship mindset.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with SaaS ERP or business automation systems.
  • Experience in F&B, meal prep, or subscription-based businesses.
  • DevOps knowledge (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience building AI dashboards.

Success Metrics (KPIs)

  • AI features delivered across products.
  • Reduction in churn using predictive AI.
  • AI adoption across BizoSuite modules.
  • Prediction accuracy performance.
  • Business impact through AI insights.
